fruits.name: Apple
fruits.description: An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree. Apple trees are cultivated worldwide and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus.

fruits.name: Banana
fruits.description: A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa. In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called plantains, distinguishing them from dessert banana

fruits.name: Grapes
fruits.description: A small bunched fruit used to make wine

fruits.name: Pineapple
fruits.description: a large fruit that goes well with ice cream

fruits.name: Tomato
fruits.description: The tomato is the edible, often red, berry of the plant Solanum lycopersicum, commonly known as a tomato plant. The species originated in western South America and Central America.

fruits.name: Cherry
fruits.description: A cherry is the fruit of many plants of the genus Prunus, and is a fleshy drupe. Commercial cherries are obtained from cultivars of several species, such as the sweet Prunus avium and the sour Prunus cerasus.
